We did indeed! Before the Zilean update was released, we had some time to tinker with broader ideas. In the end we didn't have the scope or resources to do more at that time, but the passive was definitely on our radar. At the time, I tested two main takes on the passive:

* Passive as rewind

There are a couple potential versions of this. The one we played with was, "Zilean can reactivate a spell while it's cooling down to cast it again. Doing so puts the passive on the spell's remaining cooldown," revolving around the choice of which spell to get back. I could also easily imagine a version of this that works identically to current rewind. One caveat to this approach is that rewind means the other spells have to be such that they're strong within reason when cast twice. That's not too hard when you've got two other spells to play with, but when there's three it gets a little trickier to make them all still feel good. Not a deal-breaker but something to keep in mind!

* Passive as warp

I tried a bunch of versions of this. Generally they involved Zilean being able to go to a place and mark it, then later return there by clicking on a thing there or by using his (targetable) recall on the spot. For example, one had it such that if Zilean stood still for a few moments, he'd leave behind a little ghost of himself he could click to warp back there.

In the short range warp case, it was cool and timey but didn't fit Zilean's gameplay well--he doesn't have a lot of reason to want to dart around and be mobile, so all it really did was make him safer. It also didn't fit his feel well outside his theme--characters that dash around a lot tend feel frenetic, hyperactive and tricksy; Zilean's feel is more "above it all", fast but calculated and in broad strokes, almost godlike. The summoner teleport-y versions were kind of neat, but didn't do much that summoner teleport didn't already do unless the way the spots were generated was extra interesting. Generating spots where Zilean saved someone with Chronoshift or where someone died was kind of cool, but felt more necromantic than temporal.

Generally I think using Rewind as the passive could work, but the idea I'm currently most interested is a spiced up XP passive. Things like more concentrated/interesting gameplay around XP, or potentially letting Zilean exceed level 18 are the things I'd like to look at if I get another chance to work on Zilean. Him getting some play in LJL was an awesome surprise, I really wanna see more of this guy on the rift.

If you could find a way to make Zilean do unique stuff with experience and leveling, that could be fantastic, as it's a niche that's unique to him, even if it's not currently implemented in the best way. Would this be a passive that would only benefit Zilean, or would you also look to him being able to accelerate his allies' leveling?  I imagine an issue you'd have to tackle is that of remaining manageable even with an XP lead, since Zilean's current damage ramps up especially fast in the laning phase before significantly mellowing out, and preventing his allies from snowballing too hard may also be something to address.

On the subject of making every basic ability double-cast, though, I feel it's already possible even now. Time Bomb has enough damage on its own to be a noticeable ability, and its stun combo manages to be both strong and difficult enough to achieve that Zil doesn't go overboard with QWQ. Double-casting E doesn't seem to be really problematic, and I imagine potentially designing another active to work with a passive Rewind would allow you to better tailor a time-related skill to it that would remain under control.

I think that the best direction to look for a new passive would have to involve something that combines Zilean's traits of being highly learned (which his current passive makes an attempt at) but also the fact that he is afflicted with "Chrono-Displasia" according to his lore, which is a really cool concept that is severely under-utilized within his kit. For those unfamiliar (as in, haven't read his lore) his Chrono-Displasia means that his consciousness is not linked securely to his body, allowing his mind to travel backwards and forwards in time, but not able to directly alter events, only to witness and learn from them.

I'm not sure how that could be worked into a functional passive or some other aspect of his kit, but it is a really under-developed aspect to his identity that would be pretty awesome to dive into and explore a bit more directly.

You are making him into a different champion.  It's interesting theorycrafting but it would essentially change everything about his playstyle.  He DOES have a very, very specific and in-depth playstyle regarding the spacing of your double bombs in teamfights, what items/levels you need to reach certain movespeed levels, the combos you can do with your rewind... (for example, you can't speed yourself AND slow an enemy before double bombing.  Your passive removes that limitation, meaning they'd have to rebalance him entirely.)

Honestly, I would like people to stop arbitrarily throwing out "timey-wimey" suggestions just because he's unpopular and they don't think his current kit is good.
